segment.source: Display a custom URL message when users try to run a blocked app (Windows 10)
segment.target: Display a custom URL message when users try to run a blocked app (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps for displaying a customized message to users when an AppLocker policy denies access to an app.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps for displaying a customized message to users when an AppLocker policy denies access to an app.

segment.source: Display a custom URL message when users try to run a blocked app
segment.target: Display a custom URL message when users try to run a blocked app

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps for displaying a customized message to users when an AppLocker policy denies access to an app.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps for displaying a customized message to users when an AppLocker policy denies access to an app.

segment.source: Using Group Policy, AppLocker can be configured to display a message with a custom URL.
segment.target: Using Group Policy, AppLocker can be configured to display a message with a custom URL.

segment.source: You can use this URL to redirect users to a support site that contains info about why the user received the error and which apps are allowed.
segment.target: You can use this URL to redirect users to a support site that contains info about why the user received the error and which apps are allowed.

segment.source: If you do not display a custom message when an apps is blocked, the default access denied message is displayed.
segment.target: If you do not display a custom message when an apps is blocked, the default access denied message is displayed.

segment.source: To complete this procedure, you must have the Edit Setting permission to edit a GPO.
segment.target: To complete this procedure, you must have the Edit Setting permission to edit a GPO.

segment.source: By default, members of the Domain Admins group, the Enterprise Admins group, and the Group Policy Creator Owners group have this permission.
segment.target: By default, members of the Domain Admins group, the Enterprise Admins group, and the Group Policy Creator Owners group have this permission.

segment.source: To display a custom URL message when users try to run a blocked app
segment.target: To display a custom URL message when users try to run a blocked app

segment.source: On the Start screen, type gpmc.msc to open the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).
segment.target: On the Start screen, type gpmc.msc to open the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC).

segment.source: Navigate to the Group Policy Object (GPO) that you want to edit.
segment.target: Navigate to the Group Policy Object (GPO) that you want to edit.

segment.source: Right-click the GPO, and then click Edit.
segment.target: Right-click the GPO, and then click Edit.

segment.source: In the console tree under PoliciesAdministrative TemplatesWindows Components, click File Explorer.
segment.target: In the console tree under PoliciesAdministrative TemplatesWindows Components, click File Explorer.

segment.source: In the details pane, double-click Set a support web page link.
segment.target: In the details pane, double-click Set a support web page link.

segment.source: Click Enabled, and then type the URL of the custom Web page in the Support Web page URL box.
segment.target: Click Enabled, and then type the URL of the custom Web page in the Support Web page URL box.

segment.source: Click OK to apply the setting.
segment.target: Click OK to apply the setting.
